bug.author: nicholaschiang
bug.description:
Ran the following: <denchmark-code>$ git clone https://github.com/salu133445/musegan.git $ cd musegan/ $ virtualenv -p python3 .venv $ source .venv/bin/activate $ pip install -r requirements.txt </denchmark-code>
And got the following errors when installing dependencies using pip from requirements.txt: <denchmark-code> Using cached tensorflow_gpu-1.10.1-cp36-cp36m-manylinux1_x86_64.whl (253.2 MB) Processing /home/nchiang/.cache/pip/wheels/7c/06/54/bc84598ba1daf8f970247f550b175aaaee85f68b4b0c5ab2c6/termcolor-1.1.0-cp36-none-any.whl Collecting Werkzeug==0.14.1 Using cached Werkzeug-0.14.1-py2.py3-none-any.whl (322 kB) Requirement already satisfied: setuptools in ./.venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from protobuf==3.6.1->-r requirements.txt (line 11)) (45.1.0) Requirement already satisfied: wheel>=0.26; python_version >= "3" in ./.venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from tensorboard==1.10.0->-r requirements.txt (line 17)) (0.33.6) ERROR: tensorflow-gpu 1.10.1 has requirement setuptools<=39.1.0, but you'll have setuptools 45.1.0 which is incompatible. </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/salu133445>@salu133445</denchmark-link> Any suggestions? I'm pretty sure that I fixed this in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/salu133445/musegan/pull/93>#93</denchmark-link> before you reverted some of those commits.

comments.comment: It seems that the setuptools version is associated to the installed Python environment as I was able to install TensorFlow without errors. Now, setuptools is not specified in requirement.txt, and I believe this was once fixed in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/salu133445/musegan/commit/0e8fb804711765438a969b99228ef7d73648daf6>0e8fb80</denchmark-link> in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/salu133445/musegan/pull/93>#93</denchmark-link> . Anyway, I reverted it back again (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/salu133445/musegan/commit/dca23bdc1bbd1a30bf56ea35ce92bba3534600c6>dca23bd</denchmark-link> ). Thanks for pointing out!
